Indicator: Adults completing some college, ≥25 years of age
dataSource: US Census \ American Community Survey
description: Percentage of adults 25 years or older who completed at least some college.

dataSource: US Census \ American Community Survey
description: Percentage of population 16 years or older unemployed but seeking work.

dataSource: US Census \ American Community Survey
description: Percentage of population with an income below 100% of the federal poverty level.

Indicator: Children living in poverty, <18 years of age
dataSource: US Census \ American Community Survey
description: Percentage of children under 18 with a family income below 100% of the federal poverty level.

Indicator: Children in single-parent households, <18 years of age
dataSource: US Census \ American Community Survey
description: Percentage of all children in family households that live in a household headed by a single parent (male or female head of household with no spouse present).

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults reporting "yes"to Have people in your neighborhood ever worked together to improve the neighborhood? For example, through a neighborhood watch, creating a community garden, building a community playground, or participating in a block party.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Premature death is represented by the years of potential life lost before age 75 (YPLL-75). YPLL is an age-adjusted rate per 100,000 population.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who rate their health as fair or poor in response to the question In general, would you say that your health is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their lifetime and currently smoke every day or "some days."

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate of deaths attributable to smoking per 100,000 adults 35 years and older. This measure is based on CDC's Smoking-Attributable Mortality, Morbidity, and Economic Costs (SAMMEC) methodology at https://apps.nccd.cdc.gov/sammec.

Indicator: Secondhand smoke exposure at home among children
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of children under 18 who live with an adult who smokes in the home.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Also known as “binge drinking”: for women, consuming 4 or more drinks on a single occasion in the last 30 days; for men, consuming 5 or more drinks on a single occasion in the last 30 days.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults with BMI greater than or equal to 30kg/m2.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who drank soda, sweetened fruit drinks, and/or bottled teas at least once a day for past 30 days.

Indicator: Premature cardiovascular disease (CVD) mortality rate per 100,000
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate per 100,000 persons of CVD deaths to persons under 65 years of age.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have been told they have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have high blood pressure or hypertension. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational hypertension only.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have or have had diabetes. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational diabetes only.

dataSource: AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 population.

dataSource: AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of persons living with diagnosed HIV having had 2 or more CD4 or viral load test results, at least 3 months apart, during a 12 month period.

dataSource: AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of persons diagnosed living with HIV, who were alive at year end and had a viral load ≤200 at most recent test. By default, persons without a viral load are classified as not being suppressed.

Indicator: Teen births per 1,000, 15-19 years of age
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Birth rate per 1,000 teen girls age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Teen chlamydia rate per 100,000, 15-19 years of age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Diagnosed chlamydia infection rate per 100,000 teens age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Teen gonorrhea rate per 100,000, 15-19 years of age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Diagnosed gonorrhea infection rate per 100,000 teens age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Mortality rate per 1,000 live-born infants under one year of age.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of live-born infants weighing less than 2,500 grams or 5 pounds 8 ounces at birth.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of births that are the fifth—or higher order—birth for the mother.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of women who received prenatal care either in the third trimester or not at all, out of all women for whom the timing of prenatal care is known.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of women initiating breastfeeding before hospital discharge, out of all women for whom breastfeeding status is known.

Indicator: Children up to date on immunizations, 19-35 months of age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of children 19-35 months completing recommended vaccination schedule 4:3:1:3 (DTaP : IPV : MMR : Hib).

Indicator: Asthma hospitalization rate per 100,000 children, <18 years of age
dataSource: Pennsylvania Health Care Cost Containment Council
description: Age-adjusted rate of hospital discharges with a primary diagnosis of asthma per 100,000 children under 18.

Indicator: Pedestrian and bicycle accidents per 100,000 children, <18 years of age
dataSource: Pennsylvania Department of Transportation
description: Rate of pedestrian and bicyclist accidents involving motor vehicles per 100,000 children under 18.

Indicator: Child mortality rate per 100,000, <18 years of age
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted mortality rate per 100,000 children under 18.

Indicator: Adults without insurance, 18-64 years of age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults 18-64 years reporting no source of insurance.

Indicator: Adults covered by Medicaid, 18-64 years of age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults 18-64 years reporting insurance coverage through Medicaid, Medical Assistance (M.A.), HealthChoices, or Access Card.

Indicator: Adults forgoing care due to cost, 18-64 years of age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults 18-64 years answering "yes" to the question In the past year, has there been any time when you were sick or injured AND did not seek health care because of the cost?

Indicator: Ambulatory care sensitive hospitalization rate per 100,000
dataSource: Pennsylvania Health Care Cost Containment Council
description: Age-adjusted rate per 100,000 persons for conditions where appropriate ambulatory care prevents or reduces the need for admission to the hospital, for population under 75 years of age.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate of cancer deaths per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Adults with colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy in lifetime, 50-74 years of age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults 50-74 years reporting ever having had a colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy.

Indicator: Women with mammography in past 2 years, 50-74 years of age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of women 50-74 years reporting having had a mammogram in the past 2 years.

Indicator: Girls completing 3-dose HPV vaccine, 13-17 years of age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of girls 13-17 years who received 3 doses of HPV vaccine out of all girls 13-17 years in the population. Data are based on local reporting of immunizations provided by clinicians, and some underreporting for adolescents may occur.

Indicator: Food establishments in compliance with food safety regulations upon initial annual inspection
dataSource: Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of food establishments in compliance with food safety regulations upon initial annual inspection by the Philadelphia Department of Public Health.

dataSource: Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of rat complaint calls to the Philadelphia Department of Public Health per 10,000 residents.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Number of homicide deaths.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Number of intentional deaths by discharge of firearm, for youth under 20 years of age.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Number of intentional deaths by discharge of firearm, for adults ≥ 20 years of age.

dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate of deaths by intentional self-harm per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Adults with diagnosed mental health condition
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults answering "yes" to the question Have you ever been diagnosed with any mental health condition, including clinical depression, anxiety disorder or bipolar disorder?

dataSource: Get Healthy Philly, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of population with limited access to healthy foods. Time trend and planning district figures reflect analyses of high-poverty areas with low to no walkable access to healthy food as assessed in this report: http://www.phila.gov/health/pdfs/Food_access_report.pdf.

dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults reporting at least monthly use in response to the question In the past year, how often did you use public recreation facilities in your neighborhood, such as public swimming pools, parks, schools, walking trails, bike paths or recreation centers? Response options included "more than once a week," "once a week," "a few times a month," "once a month," "less than once a month," "never."

dataSource: Pennsylvania Department of Transportation
description: Rate of pedestrian and bicyclist accidents involving motor vehicles per 100,000 persons.
